page.title: 05CHANGES MADE AT HOTHAM HALL
page.content: Hotham Hall was built in l7l0 and there were further additions in 1782 and 1882. Additional bathrooms have been put in and central heating replaced coal fires in bedrooms. The lake was dug out in 1968 using machines. Previous excavations had been in 1898 using wheelbarrows and spades. Before electricity came to Hotham it had its own generator and once when an important visitor came, one man had to stay with it all night to stop the lights going out. Two land mines fell in 1952 causing considerable damage to the Hall. Historically, Hotham Hall was the local landowner's home and they possessed about 4000 acres, but now the present owners have less than 30 acres. Sadly the Hall had to be sold in 1985 but much of the land is still farmed by the original owners.
